technical-information.title-of-invention: Curved blade adapted for a snow blower provided with and interchangeable cutting edge and of a sliding protective plate fixed under the curved blade replaceing the ground shoe

subdoc-abstract.paragraph: A curved blade mounted to bottom from both curved sides joining the blade rotation mechanism components assembling allows the height adjustment according to the desired rotational movement, and is assembled to the parts for transmitting motion fixed onto the snow blower. A sliding protective plate replacing the ground shoe, is mounted under the curved blade provided with an interchangeable cutting edge protecting the curved blade and the gravel inputs or all other materials during the snow blowing.

The curved blade and the blade rotation mechanism components assembling are configured for allow to be assembled to the parts for transmitting motion fixed onto the snow blower adapted for a wheel tractor.

section.heading: BACKGROUND OF THE INVENTION
section.paragraph: [0001] 1. Field of the Invention

[0002] The present invention relates to a curved blade mounted to bottom from both curved sides joining the blade rotation mechanism components assembling allows the height adjustment according to the desired rotational movement, and is assembled to the parts for transmitting motion fixed onto the snow blower.
[0003] 2. Description of the Related Art
[0004] A search of prior art records has unveiled the following Canadian patents:
[0005] 1. No 2,224,443 issued in 1998 to Pronovost;
[0006] 2. No 2,056,837 issued in 1998 to Pronovost;
[0007] 3. No 2,256,908 issued in 2001 to Wessman;
[0008] 4. No 1,161,462 issued in 1984 to Kelly;
[0009] 5. No 994098 issued in 1976 to Vincent; and
[0010] 6. No 2,240,436 issued in 2000 to Pronovost.

[0011] The patent issued in 2000 to Pronovost is probably the most relevant. As can be seen, a problem encountered with use of the retractable pivoting scraper blade for snow blower to Pronovost is that, it must to install of each side from the snow blower the ground shoe for that the snow blower slides in order to avoid the damaging of the blade, snow blower and the gravel inputs during the snow blowing.

[0012] To overcome the above-mentioned problem, in accordance with the teachings of the invention, there is disclosed a curved blade mounted to bottom from both curved sides joining the blade rotation mechanism components assembling allows the height adjustment according to the desired rotational movement, and is assembled to the parts for transmitting motion fixed onto the snow blower, which is relatively simple and economical to manufacture.

[0013] A sliding protective plate replacing the ground shoe is mounted under the curved blade provided with an interchangeable cutting edge protecting the curved blade and the gravel inputs or all other materials during the snow blowing.

section.heading: SUMMARY OF THE INVENTION
section.paragraph: [0014] The gist of the invention is therefore to provide a curved blade with the blade rotation mechanism components assembling allowing the height adjustment according to the desired rotational movement, and assembled onto a snow blower for allow the snow blowing and scraping in moving forward when the curved blade is in horizontal position, and to blow the snow to go backwards when the curved blade is in vertical position.

[0015] A sliding protective plate replacing the ground shoe is mounted under the curved blade provided with an interchangeable cutting edge protecting the curved blade and the gravel inputs or all other materials during the snow blowing.

section.heading: BRIEF DESCRIPTION OF THE SEVERAL VIEWS OF THE DRAWING(S)
section.paragraph: [0016] Having thus generally described the nature of the present invention, reference will now be made to the accompanying drawings, showing by way of illustration a preferred embodiment thereof and in which:

[0017] FIG. 1 is a side view of a curved blade mounted to bottom from curved both sides joined to the blade rotation mechanism components assembling, and assembled to the parts for transmitting motion fixed onto a snow blower shown-in phantom lines—allowing a rotational movement in vertical position for blow the snow to go backwards in accordance with the teachings of the invention;

[0018] FIG. 2 is a side view of a curved blade mounted to bottom from curved both sides joined to the blade rotation mechanism components assembling, and assembled to the parts for transmitting motion fixed onto a snow blower shown-in phantom lines—allowing a rotational movement in horizontal position for scrape and blow the snow in moving forward;

[0019] FIG. 3 is a side view of a curved blade mounted to bottom from curved both sides joined to the blade rotation mechanism components assembling, and assembled to the parts for transmitting motion fixed onto a snow blower shown-in phantom lines—showing the curved blade and the blade rotation mechanism components assembling in an inoperational position;

[0020] FIG. 4 is a perspective view of the curved blade mounted to bottom from curved both sides, and of the blade rotation mechanism components assembling, assembled to the parts for transmitting motion fixed onto the snow blower; and

[0021] FIG. 5 is an exploded view of the blade rotation mechanism components assembling, and of the parts for transmitting motion fixed onto the snow blower, disassembled from the curved blade mounted to bottom from curved both sides.

section.heading: DETAILED DESCRIPTION OF THE INVENTION
section.paragraph: [0022] Now referring to the drawings, and in particular to FIG. 1 to 5, a curved blade mounted to bottom from curved both sides embodying the elements of the present invention and generally designated by numeral (2) will be described. More particularly, the curved blade (2) mounted to bottom from curved both sides is intended to be used in connection with a snow blower (1) adapted to a wheel tractor.

[0023] As illustrated in FIGS. 1 to 3, the curved blade (2) mounted to bottom from curved both sides, and the blade rotation mechanism components assembling is assembled to the parts for transmitting motion fixed onto the snow blower (1) by the blade rotation mechanism (6) and levers (7) which activate the arms cylinder (3) joined to the curved blade (2) mounted to bottom from curved both sides. The blade rotation mechanism components assembling is activated by two hydraulic cylinders (4) fixed to the snow blower (1) by the end stop (5). A sliding protective plate (12) replacing the ground shoe is mounted under the curved blade (2) provided with an interchangeable cutting edge (13) protecting the curved blade (2) and the gravel inputs or all other materials during the snow blowing.

[0024] Referring mainly to FIGS. 4 and 5, the curved blade (2) mounted to bottom from curved both sides is made of suitable material which exibits excellent hardness, resistance and toughness properties, comprising three principal components, wherein a short cylindrical part (9) including an internal squared shape passes through a short cylidrical part (8) provided with cup grease (11) for the lubricating of this one. The elongated squared pressure part (10) passes through the blade rotation mechanism (6) making turn the short cylindrical part (9) inwardly from the short cylindrical part (8).

subdoc-claims.heading: The embodiments of the invention for which an exclusive property or privilege is claimed, are defined as follows:

claim.claim-text: 1. Means for releasably mounted a curved blade on a snow blower, said means comprising: a curved blade mounted to bottom from curved both sides of said blade, the blade rotation mechanism components assembling is mounted to the parts for transmitting motion fixed to the snow blower by the blade rotation mechanism, and levers activate the arms cylinder joined to the curved blade mounted to said bottom from curved both sides of said blade, said blade rotation mechanism components assembling is activated by two hydraulic cylinders fixed to the snow blower by the end stop, a sliding protective plate replacing the ground shoe is mounted under said curved blade provided with an interchangeable cutting edge protecting said curved blade and the gravel inputs or all other materials during the snow blowing.

2. The means according to claim 1, in which said curved blade mounted to said bottom from curved both sides is made of suitable material which exibits excellent hardness, resistance and toughness properties, comprises three principal components, which a short cylindrical part including an internal squared shape passes through a short cylindrical part provided with cup grease for the lubricating of said part. The elongated squared pressure part passes through said blade rotation mechanism making turn said short cylindrical part inwardly from said short cylindrical part.
